column4: Hey guys, I'm having a problem with my desktop, in that any sudo command in the terminal will just pause as soon as I enter it, and refuses to ever ask for my password, or ctrl+c cancel.
is this a new problem or has it done it since install?
It's just started yesterday, and I've had the machine running for 3+ weeks
have you run any updates or anything?
I have been, I don't remember if the problems corresponded with that, though. :S
i've never incountered that... maybe a little google-fu?
I've been looking around, I haven't found anything useful so far.
even ctrl+\ won't stop the sudo command
can you background it even? ctr-z
nope, refuses to listen to anything.
thats not good
could this problem be related to gnome-keyring-d?
/var/log/syslog says it got a segfault.
the logs are a good place for info. you may need to reinstall some packages
know of a way to (re)install packages without the use of sudo? :P  I can get stuff to my desktop from an external hd
ummmmm... good point... cant you boot root from the cd? or something.. it's been a while
I guess I could use the recovery mode, where I can use sudo
i think thats about your only option right now, unless someone who knows more can chime in
thanks for the help :P
sorry i wasnt too knowledgable on the subject
but you're welcome :)
It seems to be a super-general problem, I wasn't expecting much. ^^
